interfaces.name: DrawCircleCoordinates
iCircleMenuItem
iDrawCircle
MenuItem
ProfileMenuItemData

properties.name: importance
properties.description: Importance of the menu item will be used to calculate the arc degree size of the menu item and the drawn circle between all other menu items.
properties.rawdescription:
Importance of the menu item will be used
to calculate the arc degree size of the menu item
and the drawn circle between all other menu items.

properties.name: offset
properties.description:
Offset for making the importance of the drawn circle bigger or smaller.

Changing this will automatically change the next item's offset by adding the missing offset or subtracting the exceeding offset.

Unit is in degree, so be carefully with the value you set, or it may break the menu. Recommended value is between -30 and 30.

Also notice that the menu will be drawn in a counterclockwise direction.
properties.rawdescription:
Offset for making the importance
of the drawn circle bigger or smaller.

Changing this will automatically change
the next item's offset by adding the missing offset
or subtracting the exceeding offset.

Unit is in degree, so be carefully with the value you set,
or it may break the menu. Recommended value is between -30 and 30.

Also notice that the menu will be drawn in a counterclockwise direction.

You can change the start point with the [startAt] input.

methodsClass.name: _drawSize
methodsClass.rawdescription: Draw the size of the circle.

components.description:
Circle Component The circle can be displayed in different sizes, also it can be filled with a percentage.

  • You can change color of the track circle from css by overriding the --track-bar-color variable.
  • You can change color of the track bar from css by overriding the --track-bar-bg-color variable.
<cv-circle [size]="200" [weight]="10"></cv-circle>
components.rawdescription:
Circle Component
The circle can be displayed in different sizes, also it can be filled with a percentage.

   - You can change color of the track circle from css by
     overriding the --track-bar-color variable.
   - You can change color of the track bar from css by
     overriding the --track-bar-bg-color variable.
```html
<cv-circle [size]="200" [weight]="10"></cv-circle>
```

inputsClass.rawdescription: Position of anchor point of the arc.
inputsClass.description: Position of anchor point of the arc.

inputsClass.name: arcDegree
inputsClass.rawdescription:
Degree of the circle.
360 is a full circle.
inputsClass.description: Degree of the circle. 360 is a full circle.

inputsClass.name: positionDegree
inputsClass.rawdescription:
Position of the center the arc.
0 = top, 90 = right, 180 = bottom, 270 = left.
inputsClass.description: Position of the center the arc. 0 = top, 90 = right, 180 = bottom, 270 = left.

methodsClass.name: _polarToCartesian
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Calculate the Cartesian coordinates of the point on the circle
with the given angle and radius from the center.
methodsClass.description: Calculate the Cartesian coordinates of the point on the circle with the given angle and radius from the center.

jsdoctags.comment: X coordinate of the center of the circle.
Y coordinate of the center of the circle.

getSignature.name: arcPercentage
getSignature.rawdescription:
Percentage of the circle.
100 is a full circle.
getSignature.description: Percentage of the circle. 100 is a full circle.

components.templateData:
<svg xmlns="http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"
     [attr.viewBox]="'00 00 ' + viewBoxSize + ' ' + viewBoxSize" preserveAspectRatio="xMidYMid" class="circleContainer"
     [style.width.px]="size" [style.height.px]="size">
  <circle *ngIf="showRefCircle" [style.stroke-width]="circleWeight" [attr.cx]="60" [attr.cy]="60" [attr.r]="54" class="inCircle">
  </circle>
  <path class="circle"
        [style.stroke-width]="weight"
        [attr.d]="'M ' +leftArc.x+', ' + leftArc.y +
        ' A 50 50 0 ' + (arcPercentage > 50 ? 1 : 0) + ' 0 ' + rightArc.x + ', ' + rightArc.y"
  >
  </path>
</svg>

components.name: HeaderComponent
components.templateData:
<mat-toolbar class="bg-transparent">
  <cv-menu></cv-menu>
  <button mat-icon-button class="example-icon favorite-icon" aria-label="Example icon-button with heart icon">
    <mat-icon>favorite</mat-icon>
  </button>
  <button mat-icon-button class="example-icon" aria-label="Example icon-button with share icon">
    <mat-icon>share</mat-icon>
  </button>
</mat-toolbar>

Value is 0 Main value of the slider.

inputsClass.rawdescription: Value digits after the decimal point.

propertiesClass.rawdescription: Invoked method when the slider is dragged.

methodsClass.rawdescription: Calculate the angle of the handle.

methodsClass.name: _preventCross
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Prevent the handle to go over the min and max values.
Listen to the activated quarters to know where the handle comes from.
methodsClass.description: Prevent the handle to go over the min and max values. Listen to the activated quarters to know where the handle comes from.

methodsClass.name: _updateQuarters
methodsClass.rawdescription:
Calculate the active quarters from current value.
This is needed to constraint the handle to pass through all quarters of the circle.
See allowCross

When sliding, update activated quarters.
methodsClass.description:
Calculate the active quarters from current value. This is needed to constraint the handle to pass through all quarters of the circle. See allowCross

When sliding, update activated quarters.

components.description:
Input Circle Slider Component Works with the ngModel directive Uses the controlValueAccessor interface to work with the ngModel directive

<input-circle-slider [(ngModel)]="value"></input-circle-slider>
```html
<input-circle-slider [(ngModel)]="value" [min]="0" [max]="100" [step]="1"></input-circle-slider>
components.rawdescription:
Input Circle Slider Component
Works with the ngModel directive
Uses the controlValueAccessor interface to work with the ngModel directive
```html
<input-circle-slider [(ngModel)]="value"></input-circle-slider>
```html
<input-circle-slider [(ngModel)]="value" [min]="0" [max]="100" [step]="1"></input-circle-slider>
```
